Submodules¶

comet.agent.core.action module¶

class comet.agent.core.action.Action[source]¶

Bases: object

class comet.agent.core.action.DialogueAct(intent='', params=None)[source]¶

Bases: comet.agent.core.action.Action

Represents a dialogue act, which as a type (e.g. inform, request, etc.) and a list of DialogueActItem parameters, which are triplets of <slot, operator, value>.

add_item(item)[source]¶

Appends a dialogue act item to params, if it does not already exist.

Parameters

item – a dialogue act item to be appended to params

Returns

nothing

classmethod from_dict(intent, data, op=None)[source]¶

Get Dialogue act from intent and slot-value dictionary

Parameters

  • intent (str) – The intent

  • data (Union[List[Dict], Dict]) – The dictionary of slot-value pair

  • op – Operator, default is Operator.EQ

Returns: a DialogueAct

Return type

DialogueAct

Bases: object

This class contain a single conversation. It’s including some turns in it

Update turn into dialogue :type turn: Turn :param turn: current turn to be updated :return: None

comet.agent.core.state module¶

State models the internal state of a Conversational Agent. It is the abstract parent class of any State and it defines the interface that should be adhered to. States may be accessed by any stateful module but should only be updated by the dialogue_state_tracker.

comet.agent.core.utils.convert_dialogue_act_to_payload(acts)[source]¶

Convert a dialogue act to payload. Example act = [DialogueAct(inform, [DialogueItem(price, 100k), DialogueItem(brand, My)]) payload = /inform{“price”: “100k”, “brand”: “My”}

Parameters

acts (List[DialogueAct]) – current dialogue act

Returns:

Return type

str

Correct the params of DialogueAct. If the slot is none or None, we discard out of params
